incidents.name: Login issue for workspaces using custom domains - Use *.stoplight.io domain for workspace login

incident_updates.body:
## **Incident Root Cause Analysis and Post-Mortem**

### **Incident Summary:**

Incident Date: 7 June 2023

Stoplight experienced an issue where workspaces with custom domains were unable to login via the custom domain URL due to a CORS error.  Workspaces were still available for login via their \*.stoplight.io domains.  The issue was resolved 9 hours and 35 minutes after initial urgent support case escalation.

### **Timeline of Events:**

#### **Wednesday, June 7, 2023**

* **14:22 CDT** - Stoplight released a change to production which affected login for workspaces accessed via custom domains
* **16:41 CDT -** Initial indication of potential issue based on receipt of non-urgent support case, issue investigation begins
* **23:41 CDT -** Initial indication of broader issue impact based on receipt of first Urgent/P1 support case

**Wednesday, June 7, 2023**

* **08:06 CDT -** Investigation concludes, root cause identified, Stoplight initiates release roll-back process
* **09:16 CDT -**  Production roll-back completed, issue resolved

### **Root Cause:**

* Stoplight experienced an issue where workspaces with custom domains were unable to login via the custom domain URL due to a CORS error.
* The issue was not caught before making it into production by Stoplight’s build validation testing and was not immediately caught after release to production by Stoplight’s stack and log monitoring instrumentation.
* While Stoplight initiated incident response mechanisms to investigate and address the issue, it was not immediately clear of the broader impact to customer workspaces until urgent support cases began coming in after standard operating hours.

### **Remediation Actions**

* Stoplight will be adding non [stoplight.io](http://stoplight.io) and [stoplight-dev.io](http://stoplight-dev.io) custom domains for pre-release development and qa login testing
* Stoplight is implementing additional pre-release end to end tests for service-auth CORS operations and custom domains and adding production metrics/alerts for 500s for login URLs
* Stoplight is revising incident response mechanisms to better identify broader issue impact and improve time to resolution for non-business-hour urgent incidents.

Stoplight is experiencing an issue where workspaces with custom domains are unable to login via the custom domain URL due to a CORS error.  Workspaces are still available for login via their *.stoplight.io domains.

incidents.name: Stoplight Infrastructure Maintenance (Up to 45 mins downtime) Oct 4, 21:30 Central Daylight Time - Cont'd

incident_updates.body: Maintenance: Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. -  Update: there may be up to 45 minutes of downtime on the Stoplight SaaS Platform during the maintenance window.

In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Oct 04, 2022 - 21:00 CDT

Update - On the evening of October 4, 2022 Stoplight will be performing scheduled maintenance on the Stoplight platform infrastructure beginning at 9:00 PM Central Daylight Time (02:00 UTC).  Based on our data points and testing, there may be up to 30 minutes of downtime on the Stoplight SaaS Platform during the maintenance window.

incident_updates.body: Based on our monitoring of this issue over the last week, we are confident the optimization changes have positively impacted the editing of projects. At this time we will be resolving this Incident, however, we continue to closely monitor the editing of projects.
We have applied multiple optimization changes to the Stoplight Platform mitigating further issues with editing projects. We continue to monitor the situation closely.

We have identified the problem and are actively working on a full resolution. Editing projects may be intermittent for web based projects. We have documented the workarounds for this issue here: Cannot Edit Stoplight Projects.

Our engineering team is actively working on this issue, we apologize for the impact this has caused you and your teams. At this time we do not have an expected resolution for the performance degradation issues and expect them to be ongoing. They may stabilize for a time and then destabilize. We have documented the workarounds for this issue here: Cannot Edit Stoplight Projects

incidents.name: Certificate issue caused clients to experience CORS errors, issues logging in

incident_updates.body: An internal certificate expired, causing clients to experience CORS errors and problems logging in. We have implemented a workaround while we investigate what led to the failure and restore our certificate renewal service to healthy operation.

affected_components.name: Github (github.com) - GitHub Visit www.githubstatus.com for more information

incident_updates.body:
At approximately 4:10PM CST on Friday, March 6th, an outage occurred while performing a routine upgrade of the Stoplight Next Hubs service. During this upgrade, an outdated configuration was accidentally deployed to the Hubs production environment. This issue prevented the Hubs service from starting correctly, leading to Stoplight Next documentation sites being temporarily unavailable from approximately 4:10 until 4:25PM CST. Once the issue was identified, the configuration was reverted and the service was restored.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience posed by this outage. We have updated our internal upgrade process to re-validate configurations before applying them to ensure this issue does not happen again.

Please don't hesitate to reach out to support@stoplight.io if you have any further questions or concerns regarding this issue.

incidents.name: DDOS on our classic applications causing outage

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
A fix has been deployed. All builds should be successful and with the latest changes to your Hubs. If you are experiencing any issues, please let us know at support@stoplight.io.

Due to a caching issue on our end, newly published changes will not appear as live in your published Hub. The team has identified the issue and is working on a fix. We will provide more updates when available. Your existing published Hubs should be seeing no issues.
This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating reports of intermittent issues when resolving/exporting files. We believe we have mitigated the immediate issue, but are still investigating root cause.

Starting at approximately 07:05 UTC the Stoplight Classic API encountered a runtime error that resulted in intermittent request failures and HTTP 503's being returned to clients. The error was fully resolved as of 10:50 UTC, and all service functionality has returned to normal. We apologize for any inconvenience this error may have caused.

Starting at approximately 07:30 UTC today our backend API encountered a system error, resulting in dropped requests and HTTP 504's being returned to clients. The system error has now been resolved, and all functionality has returned to normal.
This incident has been resolved.
